etymologies: mid 19th century (originally US): from Latin American Spanish cafetería ‘coffee shop’

definitions: a restaurant or dining room in a school or a business in which customers serve themselves or are served from a counter and pay before eating.
shortDefinitions: restaurant in which customers serve themselves from counter

definitions: denoting a system in which people may choose from a number of available options, especially one in which an employee may select a personal package of company benefits

examples.text: employers who offer cafeteria plans and other flexible programs

shortDefinitions: denoting system in which people choose from several options
